lead_paragraph: As part of a citywide plan, $40 million will be spread across the parks and fences will come down in an effort to make the spaces more welcoming to their neighborhoods.

byline.original: By RICK ROJAS and NOAH REMNICK

headline.print_headline: Breaking Down Barriers at Eight City Parks
headline.main: Overhauling 8 Parks, New York Seeks to Create More Inviting Spaces

snippet: As part of a citywide plan, $40 million will be spread across the parks and fences will come down in an effort to make the spaces more welcoming to their neighborhoods.
abstract: New York City announces rehabilitation of eight city parks, $40 million project aimed at integrating public spaces better with neighborhoods and making them more welcoming; plan includes removal of high chain link fences once intended to deter crime, as well as installation of new benches, greenery and walkways.
